title: Typeface ID Request - Squarish / Geometric Font (close to Stratum2 but not)
content:
Hi guys,

[Picture Here](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018063512/http:/static4.businessinsider.com/image/4f0e301feab8ea060e00001c-900/great-name.jpg)

I'm after an ID for this typeface please. Specifically the word ORION, I suspect the smaller words are set in Neutraface.

I did suspect Stratum2 for the ORION, but it looks a little off, in particular the R.

Any help appreciated.

Cheers!
author: oller

comments.content: ORION is [ONRAMP](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018063512/http:/www.losttype.com/font/?name=ONRAMP) and "THE [...] ROOM" is possibly [Neutraface 2 Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018063512/http:/www.houseind.com/fonts/neutraface2/viewfonts) using the alternate /M with sloping verticals.

Hey Ryuk,, cheers for the post but I'm not sure if that's it.

The leg of the R protrudes out further in the photo than in the Onramp sample?  
Plus Onramp seems to have more rounded corners.

Of course, I can't be 100% positive but still convinced it's ONRAMP. Have a look [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018063512/http:/static3.businessinsider.com/image/4f0e30226bb3f72b0b000026-900/a-lot-of-meetings-everywhere.jpg) and [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018063512/http:/static1.businessinsider.com/image/4f0e302969beddb364000044-900/and-everyone-was-busy-at-work-so-we-are-heading-out.jpg) and you'll see others letters such as /A, /W and /M that, to me, can't lie.
And Jan is correct for "THE ROOM" even if Neutraface 2 was not so far ;)

My apologies Ryuk, having tried ON RAMP installed on my machine, it looks exactly the same, perfect match.

It's odd - the characters in the sample image on lost-type, don't seem to exactly match those in the font itself.

Thanks again!
